intro: Dortmanna digitalifolia, commonly known as the fingerleaf dock, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible parts. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often lobed or toothed, giving it a striking appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Dortmanna digitalifolia is often found in wetlands, along stream banks, and in other moist habitats.
